summary: This is an email auto-reply notification from August 9, 2019, indicating the sender will be out of the office from August 5-9, 2019, with limited access. It includes a list of work orders for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The document appears to be routine facility maintenance communication from the MCC.
locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: This email is dated August 9, 2019, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
The document originates from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, the facility where Epstein was incarcerated.
The content lists routine maintenance work orders (e.g., door repairs, phone issues) for the MCC, suggesting normal facility operations were ongoing.
The email is an auto-reply, indicating key personnel were out of the office during the week of Epstein's death.
The document is part of the Epstein case files released by the US Department of Justice, though its direct relevance to the case is not immediately apparent from the text.
